2. "A Tale of Two Cities" (1859) - This classic novel by Charles Dickens tells the story of two men who are brought together by chance circumstances in London during the reign of King George IV. One of these men is Charles Darnay, who is a wealthy English businessman and his wife Agnes are expecting their first child. The other man is Sydney Carton, who is an alcoholic lawyer from England who is hired by Darnay to investigate his finances after he has been diagnosed with syphilis.
The novel tells the story of how Darnay becomes disillusioned with capitalism and the materialistic lifestyle that it promotes. This disillusionment leads Darnay to become a more compassionate and altruistic person, who is willing to put aside his own personal desires in order to help others and make the world a better place.
The novel also tells the story of how Carton becomes disillusioned with capitalism and the materialistic lifestyle that it promotes.
